results.title: Life in the Desert
results.brief_description: The viewer is taken into the Australian desert and shown the amazing variety of plants and animals and informed how they manage to survive in such extreme conditions.

results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.

results.title: Factory production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Expert, Russell Lansbury, talks about the use of computers in factory production, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.

results.title: Rosalie Gascoigne
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Rosalie Gascoigne talks about her work and interests. She is a self-taught assemblage artist who uses weathered, discarded junk from man-made objects and found objects from nature. Her assemblages create images of domestic country kitchens while her late installations have an outdoor open feeling for country air and light

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 07
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. The RAAF flight in the Antarctic use Canadian “Beaver” aircraft. 2. RAAF personnel are trained by firemen in Melbourne. 3. The Lockheed Hercules transport. 4. The “Jindivik” pilotless aircraft, designed and built in Australia, shown in flight at Woomera range.

results.title: The Story of Menstruation
results.brief_description: This film was made as an outgrowth of Disney’s contract work with the armed forces during World War II. “The Story of menstruation” was probably the first American educational film with a woman narrator. The first half of the film discusses the natural process of menstruation through colourful yet simple diagrams, whilst the second half gives instruction on coping with behavioural changes and reinforcing gender roles, with a marriage scene followed by a picture of a young woman with her baby, suggesting “the natural course of life”. When this film was screened in schools, girls received a copy of a booklet, “Very Personally Yours”, which pushed Kotex products.
results.description: This film was made as an outgrowth of Disney’s contract work with the armed forces during World War II. “The Story of menstruation” was probably the first American educational film with a woman narrator. When this film was screened in schools, girls received a copy of a booklet, “Very Personally Yours”, which pushed Kotex products.

results.title: [Unidentified 16mm Film]

video_links.name: Uncredited footage, circa 1945, performances and parade.

results.brief_description: Film contains silent footage of various vaudeville and circus-style performances including dancing, acrobatics, slapstick comedy and more. The film also includes extensive footage of the British Navy marching in a street parade in Melbourne. One shot appears to be Elizabeth Street, featuring trams and the Flinders Street Station clocktower.
